# Aufgabenverwaltung im Projekt verstehen

## Was sind Projekt-Tasks?

Projekt-Tasks sind Aufgaben, die:
- **Projekt-spezifisch** sind (geh√∂ren zu einem Projekt)

### Listen-Ansicht

### Kanban-Ansicht

## Task-Details verstehen

**Beschreibung**
- Ausf√ºhrliche Details (optional)

## Task-Lifecycle

Der typische Ablauf einer Task:


### Task abschlie√üen

**Via Checkbox:**
- Klicke Checkbox links vom Task-Titel

- Abschluss-Timestamp wird gesetzt

**Via Button:**
1. √ñffne Task-Details
2. Klicke **"Als erledigt markieren"**
3. Optional: Abschluss-Kommentar

> **Tipp:** Erledigte Tasks bleiben sichtbar (ausgegraut), k√∂nnen aber via Filter ausgeblendet werden.

## Task-Vorlagen nutzen

Vorlagen helfen, typische PR-Workflows schnell aufzusetzen.

### Verf√ºgbare Vorlagen

**Produktlaunch-Kampagne:**
- Strategie entwickeln (Phase: Planung)
- Pressemeldung schreiben (Phase: Erstellung)

- Statement vorbereiten
- Gesch√§ftsf√ºhrung briefen

### Vorlage anwenden

1. Klicke **üìã Vorlage** (Toolbar)
2. W√§hle Vorlage aus Liste

4. Klicke **"Tasks erstellen"**

**Ergebnis:** Alle Tasks der Vorlage werden im Projekt angelegt.

> **Tipp:** Vorlagen sind Startpunkte - du kannst Tasks jederzeit anpassen oder l√∂schen.

[Screenshot: Vorlagen-Dialog]

## Benachrichtigungen

### Wann wirst du benachrichtigt?

**Als zugewiesene Person:**
- Neue Task zugewiesen
- Deadline nahe (24 Stunden vorher)
- Task √ºberf√§llig
- Kommentar auf deiner Task
- Task wurde ge√§ndert (Deadline, Priorit√§t)

**Als Projekt-Manager:**

**Als Team-Mitglied:**

### Benachrichtigungs-Kan√§le

- **In-App**: Rote Badge im Benachrichtigungs-Icon
- **E-Mail**: Digest (t√§glich oder sofort)
- **Browser-Push**: Desktop-Notifications (optional)

## H√§ufige Fragen

**Kann ich Tasks mehreren Personen zuweisen?**

Nein, jede Task hat nur einen Assignee. F√ºr Team-Aufgaben:
- Erstelle Unter-Tasks und weise einzeln zu
- ODER: Nutze Checkliste und erw√§hne Team-Mitglieder in Kommentaren

**Was passiert wenn jemand eine Task nicht schafft?**

1. Task wird rot markiert (√ºberf√§llig)
2. Projekt-Manager bekommt Benachrichtigung

   - Deadline verl√§ngern
   - Task neu zuweisen

**Kann ich Tasks au√üerhalb der Projekt-Ansicht sehen?**

**Wie l√∂sche ich erledigte Tasks?**

1. Filter: Nur "Completed" anzeigen

content.en:
# Understand Task Management in Projects

Every project in CeleroPress has an integrated task management system. Here you manage all tasks necessary for the success of your PR campaign.

## What are Project Tasks?

Project tasks are tasks that:
- **Are project-specific** (belong to a project)
- **Are assigned** (to team members)
- **Have progress** (0-100%)
- **Have deadlines** (when must it be done?)
- **Have priorities** (how important is it?)

### Difference to Regular Tasks

**Project Tasks:**
- Belong to a project
- Visible to entire project team
- Can influence pipeline phase
- Appear in project tab "Tasks"

**Regular Tasks (CeleroPress Global):**
- Personal to-dos
- Not project-bound
- Only visible to you
- In global task manager

## Open Tasks View

1. Open a project
2. Click on tab **"Tasks"**

[Screenshot: Tasks tab]

## Tasks Overview

### Toolbar (top)

**View Modes:**
- **List**: Tabular overview (default)
- **Kanban**: Board with columns by status

**Filters:**
- **My Tasks**: Only tasks assigned to you
- **All Tasks**: Entire team
- **Status Filter**: Pending / In Progress / Completed
- **Priority Filter**: Low / Medium / High / Urgent

**Actions:**
- **+ New Task**: Create task manually
- **üìã Template**: Use task template (typical PR workflows)
- **‚ãÆ More**: Export, archiving

[Screenshot: Tasks toolbar]

### List View

The default view shows tasks as a table:

**Columns:**
1. **Task**: Title and description
2. **Assigned**: Avatar of team member
3. **Progress**: Bar (0-100%)
4. **Deadline**: Due date
5. **Actions**: Edit / Complete / Delete

**Color Coding:**
- üü¢ Green: Enough time left
- üü° Yellow: Deadline near (< 3 days)
- üî¥ Red: Overdue

**Sorting:**
- Click on column header to sort
- Default: By deadline (oldest first)

[Screenshot: Tasks list]

### Kanban View

The board organizes tasks in columns:

**Columns:**
1. **Pending** (Open)
   - New tasks
   - Not started yet

2. **In Progress** (In Work)
   - Currently being worked on
   - Progress > 0%

3. **Completed** (Done)
   - Finished
   - Progress = 100%

**Drag & Drop:**
- Drag tasks between columns
- Status changes automatically

> **Tip:** Kanban is better for quick overview, list view for details.

[Screenshot: Kanban board]

## Understanding Task Details

### Task Fields

**Title***
- Brief description of task
- Example: "Write press release", "Create distribution list"

**Description**
- Detailed information (optional)
- What exactly needs to be done?
- Markdown formatting possible

**Assigned to***
- Team member who completes the task
- Only one person per task
- Person receives notification

**Deadline***
- When must task be completed?
- Datepicker or manual entry
- Optional: Time (disable for all-day tasks)

**Priority**
- Low: Can wait
- Medium: Standard priority
- High: Important, complete soon
- Urgent: Highest priority, immediate

**Status**
- Pending: Not started yet
- In Progress: Being worked on
- Completed: Done
- Blocked: Blocked (waiting for others)
- Cancelled: Cancelled

**Progress**
- 0-100% completion
- Manually set or automatic (with checklists)

### Checklist (optional)

For complex tasks you can add a checklist:

**Example:**
- ‚òê Research topic
- ‚òê Create outline
- ‚òê Write text
- ‚òê Proofread
- ‚òë Get approval

**Automatic Progress:**
- Progress = (Checked Items / Total Items) √ó 100%
- Example: 3 of 5 checked = 60%

[Screenshot: Task with checklist]

## Task Lifecycle

The typical flow of a task:

```
1. Create ‚Üí Status: Pending, Progress: 0%
2. Start ‚Üí Status: In Progress, Progress: 1-99%
3. Update progress ‚Üí Bar grows
4. Complete ‚Üí Status: Completed, Progress: 100%
```

### Start Task

1. Click on task
2. Change status to "In Progress"
3. Optional: Set progress to 10-20%
4. Begin work

### Update Task

**Set Progress:**
1. Click on progress bar
2. Drag slider or type percentage
3. Automatic saving

**Add Comment:**
1. Open task details
2. Scroll to "Activity"
3. Write update (e.g., "Outline done, starting text")
4. Team is notified

### Complete Task

**Via Checkbox:**
- Click checkbox left of task title
- Status ‚Üí Completed
- Progress ‚Üí 100%
- Completion timestamp is set

**Via Button:**
1. Open task details
2. Click **"Mark as completed"**
3. Optional: Completion comment

> **Tip:** Completed tasks remain visible (grayed out), but can be hidden via filter.

## Use Task Templates

Templates help quickly set up typical PR workflows.

### Available Templates

**Product Launch Campaign:**
- Develop strategy (Phase: Planning)
- Write press release (Phase: Creation)
- Create key visual (Phase: Creation)
- Internal approval (Phase: Approval)
- Client approval (Phase: Approval)
- Finalize distribution list (Phase: Distribution)
- Send email (Phase: Distribution)
- Collect clippings (Phase: Monitoring)

**Event Campaign:**
- Send save the date
- Write press invitation
- Manage accreditation
- Create press kit
- On-site support
- Follow-up coverage

**Crisis PR:**
- Analyze situation
- Prepare statement
- Brief management
- Contact media
- Monitor social media
- Follow-up statement

### Apply Template

1. Click **üìã Template** (toolbar)
2. Select template from list
3. Customize:
   - Team assignment
   - Deadlines (relative to today)
   - Priorities
4. Click **"Create tasks"**

**Result:** All tasks from template are created in project.

> **Tip:** Templates are starting points - you can adjust or delete tasks anytime.

[Screenshot: Template dialog]

## Notifications

### When Are You Notified?

**As assigned person:**
- New task assigned
- Deadline near (24 hours before)
- Task overdue
- Comment on your task
- Task was changed (deadline, priority)

**As project manager:**
- Task was completed
- Task is blocked
- Task deadline exceeded

**As team member:**
- @Mention in task comment
- Critical tasks blocked

### Notification Channels

- **In-App**: Red badge on notification icon
- **Email**: Digest (daily or immediate)
- **Browser Push**: Desktop notifications (optional)

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Can I assign tasks to multiple people?**

No, each task has only one assignee. For team tasks:
- Create sub-tasks and assign individually
- OR: Use checklist and mention team members in comments

**What happens if someone can't complete a task?**

1. Task is marked red (overdue)
2. Project manager receives notification
3. Options:
   - Extend deadline
   - Reassign task
   - Lower priority

**Can I see tasks outside the project view?**

Yes! Your project tasks also appear:
- In global task manager (dashboard)
- In calendar (when deadline set)
- In "Today" view (due tasks)

**How do I delete completed tasks?**

1. Filter: Show only "Completed"
2. Select tasks via checkbox
3. Bulk action ‚Üí **"Delete"**
4. Confirm

**OR:** Keep completed tasks for reporting and history.

**Can tasks be created automatically?**

Yes, during:
- Template application
- Pipeline phase change (configurable)
- Integration with external tools (API)

## Next Steps

- [Create new task](/support/en/projekte/task-erstellen)
- [Task status and workflow](/support/en/projekte/task-status)
- [Use Kanban board](/support/en/projekte/kanban-board)
- [Customize task templates](/support/en/task-vorlagen)
